title: Validate DLP/DRM is able to detect the label and applies the policy with Alert Action for Email with Encrypted Sensitivity Label coming from SMTP Proxy without enabling Proctected in filefilter
custom_preconds:
- MIP feature should be enabled
- Setup Microsot Instance under "Settings --> Sensitivity Label Integration"
- Create a filter filter profile with below fields
               - Sensitivity label -> select microsoft instance -> check "Detect object with classification label applied from the selected instance" and select desired labels
- Create a DLP profile by cloning the DLP-PCI and add the created file filter.
- Setup Exchange Domain in SMTP Under Settings -> Security Cloud Platform -> SMTP -> add Exchange account
custom_steps:
- Create a Email Outbound Policy for Exchange Domain with Alert action + DLP Profile that was created in pre-condtions.
- Draft a email in Outlookg with subject+body which matches to the DLP profile
- Assign any Encrypted Sensitivity Lable to the mail, that matched to the file filter.
- Send the email to another outlook account.
custom_expected:
- SMTP proxy should receive it and send for DLP for inspection.
- DLP should then send it to DRM for parsing and it should read the label and let DLP know that policy got matched.
- DLP Alert event should be generated and should be visible in skope-it events.
- SMTP proxy should forward to traffic to receipient
- Receipent should receive the email and content shouldn't be tampered.
- Validate the contents of email
